articles.title: Computer made from liquid crystals would ripple with calculations
articles.description: A proposal for a computer built using liquid crystals – similar to those found in LCD TVs – would use the orientation of the molecules to store data. Calculations would look like ripples through the liquid
articles.content:
By Karmela Padavic-Callaghan
Liquid crystal droplet under a microscope
Karl Gaff/Science Photo Library
Ripples and imperfections in liquid crystals like those found in TVs could be used to build a… [+2352 chars]

articles.title: Reptile boom 250 million years ago may have been due to global warming
articles.description: A spike in global temperatures could have been the trigger for the rise of reptiles towards the end of the Permian period, not a mass extinction of mammals as had been thought
articles.content:
By Corryn Wetzel
Reptiles blossomed during a period with particularly hot global temperatures
Henry Sharpe

articles.title: Some artificial sweeteners can raise your blood sugar
articles.description: Two artificial sweeteners, saccharin and sucralose, may impede the body’s ability to regulate blood sugar levels after eating, potentially due to associated changes in the microbiome

Saccharin crystals and a stevia branch
Shutterstock/wasanajai

articles.title: Shards of pure ice might snow upwards beneath the ice shell of Europa
articles.description: The moons Europa and Enceladus probably have global oceans buried beneath their frozen shells, and those seas may be home to a strange kind of ice called frazil ice
articles.content:

articles.title: Water droplets can sometimes turn into bleach when hitting a surface
articles.description: Some researchers have seen an unusual effect where microscopic water drops turn into hydrogen peroxide after hitting a surface. A series of experiments is now getting closer to uncovering why it might happen
